title: Citi Alumni Network Launched in the Philippines
summary: In time for its 200th anniversary, Citi has launched an online site that connects thousands of the bank's former employees across the globe. The Citi Alumni Network is a global electronic platform for alumni to reconnect with their former colleagues and keep up to date with news in and around Citi.
tag-1: Citi Alumni Network Launched in the Philippines
tag-2: In time for its 200th anniversary, Citi has launched an online site that connects thousands of the bank's former employees across the globe. The Citi Alumni Network is a global electronic platform for alumni to reconnect with their former colleagues and keep up to date with news in and around Citi.
tag-3: The Citi Alumni Network is one of the bank's initiatives to recognize the contributions of alumni who have gone on to achieve great success in various fields, not only in the financial services industry. Many alumni have pursued careers in different industries, including aviation, telecommunications, fast-moving consumer goods and the public sector. There are also distinguished alumni that are now recognized community leaders.
tag-4: In the Philippines, Citi is popularly referred to as the UniverCiti of Banking, having produced some of the best and brightest in the banking industry. It was at Citi where many key government officials and Chief Executive Officers (CEOs) of top corporations started their banking careers. Prominent Citi alumni include Manila Water Company President and CEO Gerry Ablaza, whose brief profile appears on the homepage of the site.
tag-5: The Citi Alumni Network is open to all alumni who worked with Citi for at least two years. Alumni are encouraged to sign up at www.citialumninetwork.com. Once the registration is complete, an email confirmation will be sent, and members can start submitting relevant news articles as well as their own alumni stories.
tag-6: "Citi alumni in the Philippines always find a way to get together – whether for an annual reunion or an event for a worthy cause," said Philippines CCO Sanjiv Vohra. "They've managed to maintain strong ties to the bank even as they moved on to grow their careers in other companies and industries. The Citi Alumni Network is a great opportunity for ex-Citi colleagues to discover old friends and remember the great time they had under the red arc."
tag-7: The Philippines alumni site features a message from Sanjiv Vohra, current news on Citi as well as a feature story on Gerry Ablaza on how Citi has powered his career and the lessons he learned while working under Citi's signature red arc.
tag-8: Citi is also making available to alumni from the website the Citi Global Perspectives & Solutions (Citi GPS), a wealth of research material designed to help Citi's clients navigate the global economy's most demanding challenges. Citi GPS not only seeks to identify future themes and trends, it also aims to help clients profit in a fast-changing and interconnected world.
tag-9: From the site, alumni can now access recent research headlines that include: (1) Upwardly Mobile: An Analysis of the Global Mobile Payments Opportunity; (2) 2012 Investment Themes: Navigating Towards a Growth Course; (3) 2012 Corporate Finance Priorities; (4) Call of the Frontier: The Search for a New Generation of Emerging Markets; and (5) Trade Transformed: The Emerging New Corridors of Trade Power.
tag-10: For more information, log on to www.citialumninetwork.com.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
